58#ifndef HEADER_X509_H
59#include <openssl/x509.h>
60/* openssl/x509.h ends up #include-ing this file at about the only
61 * appropriate moment. */
62#endif
63
64#ifndef HEADER_X509_VFY_H
65#define HEADER_X509_VFY_H
66
67#include <openssl/bio.h>
68#include <openssl/lhash.h>
69#include <openssl/thread.h>

71#ifdef __cplusplus

73#endif

75#if 0
76/* Outer object */
77typedef struct x509_hash_dir_st
78 {
79 int num_dirs;
80 char **dirs;
81 int *dirs_type;
82 int num_dirs_alloced;
83 } X509_HASH_DIR_CTX;
84#endif
85
86typedef struct x509_file_st
87 {
88 int num_paths; /* number of paths to files or directories */
89 int num_alloced;
90 char **paths; /* the list of paths or directories */
91 int *path_type;
92 } X509_CERT_FILE_CTX;
93
94/*******************************/
95/*
96SSL_CTX -> X509_STORE
97 -> X509_LOOKUP
98 ->X509_LOOKUP_METHOD
99 -> X509_LOOKUP
100 ->X509_LOOKUP_METHOD
101
102SSL -> X509_STORE_CTX
103 ->X509_STORE
104
105The X509_STORE holds the tables etc for verification stuff.
106A X509_STORE_CTX is used while validating a single certificate.
107The X509_STORE has X509_LOOKUPs for looking up certs.
108The X509_STORE then calls a function to actually verify the
109certificate chain.
110*/
111
112#define X509_LU_RETRY -1
113#define X509_LU_FAIL 0
114#define X509_LU_X509 1
115#define X509_LU_CRL 2
116#define X509_LU_PKEY 3
117
118typedef struct x509_object_st
119 {
120 /* one of the above types */
121 int type;
122 union {
123 char *ptr;
124 X509 *x509;
125 X509_CRL *crl;
126 EVP_PKEY *pkey;
127 } data;
128 } X509_OBJECT;
129
130typedef struct x509_lookup_st X509_LOOKUP;
131
132DECLARE_STACK_OF(X509_LOOKUP)
133DECLARE_STACK_OF(X509_OBJECT)
134
135/* This is a static that defines the function interface */
136typedef struct x509_lookup_method_st
137 {
138 const char *name;
139 int (*new_item)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx);
140 void (*free)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx);
141 int (*init)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx);
142 int (*shutdown)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx);
143 int (*ctrl)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx,int cmd,const char *argc,long argl,
144 char **ret);
145 int (*get_by_subject)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx,int type,X509_NAME *name,
146 X509_OBJECT *ret);
147 int (*get_by_issuer_serial)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx,int type,X509_NAME *name,
148 ASN1_INTEGER *serial,X509_OBJECT *ret);
149 int (*get_by_fingerprint)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx,int type,
150 unsigned char *bytes,int len,
151 X509_OBJECT *ret);
152 int (*get_by_alias)(X509_LOOKUP *ctx,int type,char *str,int len,
153 X509_OBJECT *ret);
154 } X509_LOOKUP_METHOD;
155
156typedef struct X509_VERIFY_PARAM_ID_st X509_VERIFY_PARAM_ID;
157
158/* This structure hold all parameters associated with a verify operation
159 * by including an X509_VERIFY_PARAM structure in related structures the
160 * parameters used can be customized
161 */
162
163typedef struct X509_VERIFY_PARAM_st
164 {
165 char *name;
166 time_t check_time; /* Time to use */
167 unsigned long inh_flags; /* Inheritance flags */
168 unsigned long flags; /* Various verify flags */
169 int purpose; /* purpose to check untrusted certificates */
170 int trust; /* trust setting to check */
171 int depth; /* Verify depth */
172 STACK_OF(ASN1_OBJECT) *policies; /* Permissible policies */
173 X509_VERIFY_PARAM_ID *id; /* opaque ID data */
174 } X509_VERIFY_PARAM;
175
176DECLARE_STACK_OF(X509_VERIFY_PARAM)
177
178/* This is used to hold everything. It is used for all certificate
179 * validation. Once we have a certificate chain, the 'verify'
180 * function is then called to actually check the cert chain. */
181struct x509_store_st
182 {
183 /* The following is a cache of trusted certs */
184 int cache; /* if true, stash any hits */
185 STACK_OF(X509_OBJECT) *objs; /* Cache of all objects */
186 CRYPTO_MUTEX objs_lock;
187
188 /* These are external lookup methods */
189 STACK_OF(X509_LOOKUP) *get_cert_methods;
190
191 X509_VERIFY_PARAM *param;
192
193 /* Callbacks for various operations */
194 int (*verify)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* called to verify a certificate */
195 int (*verify_cb)(int ok,X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* error callback */
196 int (*get_issuer)(X509 **issuer, X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509 *x); /* get issuers cert from ctx */
197 int (*check_issued)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509 *x, X509 *issuer); /* check issued */
198 int (*check_revocation)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* Check revocation status of chain */
199 int (*get_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL **crl, X509 *x); /* retrieve CRL */
200 int (*check_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL *crl); /* Check CRL validity */
201 int (*cert_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL *crl, X509 *x); /* Check certificate against CRL */
202 STACK_OF(X509) * (*lookup_certs)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_NAME *nm);
203 STACK_OF(X509_CRL) * (*lookup_crls)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_NAME *nm);
204 int (*cleanup)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx);
205
206 CRYPTO_refcount_t references;
207 } /* X509_STORE */;
208
209OPENSSL_EXPORT int X509_STORE_set_depth(X509_STORE *store, int depth);
210
211#define X509_STORE_set_verify_cb_func(ctx,func) ((ctx)->verify_cb=(func))
212#define X509_STORE_set_verify_func(ctx,func) ((ctx)->verify=(func))
213
214/* This is the functions plus an instance of the local variables. */
215struct x509_lookup_st
216 {
217 int init; /* have we been started */
218 int skip; /* don't use us. */
219 X509_LOOKUP_METHOD *method; /* the functions */
220 char *method_data; /* method data */
221
222 X509_STORE *store_ctx; /* who owns us */
223 } /* X509_LOOKUP */;
224
225/* This is a used when verifying cert chains. Since the
226 * gathering of the cert chain can take some time (and have to be
227 * 'retried', this needs to be kept and passed around. */
228struct x509_store_ctx_st /* X509_STORE_CTX */
229 {
230 X509_STORE *ctx;
231 int current_method; /* used when looking up certs */
232
233 /* The following are set by the caller */
234 X509 *cert; /* The cert to check */
235 STACK_OF(X509) *untrusted; /* chain of X509s - untrusted - passed in */
236 STACK_OF(X509_CRL) *crls; /* set of CRLs passed in */
237
238 X509_VERIFY_PARAM *param;
239 void *other_ctx; /* Other info for use with get_issuer() */
240
241 /* Callbacks for various operations */
242 int (*verify)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* called to verify a certificate */
243 int (*verify_cb)(int ok,X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* error callback */
244 int (*get_issuer)(X509 **issuer, X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509 *x); /* get issuers cert from ctx */
245 int (*check_issued)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509 *x, X509 *issuer); /* check issued */
246 int (*check_revocation)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx); /* Check revocation status of chain */
247 int (*get_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL **crl, X509 *x); /* retrieve CRL */
248 int (*check_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL *crl); /* Check CRL validity */
249 int (*cert_crl)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_CRL *crl, X509 *x); /* Check certificate against CRL */
250 int (*check_policy)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx);
251 STACK_OF(X509) * (*lookup_certs)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_NAME *nm);
252 STACK_OF(X509_CRL) * (*lookup_crls)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, X509_NAME *nm);
253 int (*cleanup)(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx);
254
255 /* The following is built up */
256 int valid; /* if 0, rebuild chain */
257 int last_untrusted; /* index of last untrusted cert */
258 STACK_OF(X509) *chain; /* chain of X509s - built up and trusted */
259 X509_POLICY_TREE *tree; /* Valid policy tree */
260
261 int explicit_policy; /* Require explicit policy value */
262
263 /* When something goes wrong, this is why */
264 int error_depth;
265 int error;
266 X509 *current_cert;
267 X509 *current_issuer; /* cert currently being tested as valid issuer */
268 X509_CRL *current_crl; /* current CRL */
269
270 int current_crl_score; /* score of current CRL */
271 unsigned int current_reasons; /* Reason mask */
272
273 X509_STORE_CTX *parent; /* For CRL path validation: parent context */
274
275 CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
276 } /* X509_STORE_CTX */;
277
278OPENSSL_EXPORT void X509_STORE_CTX_set_depth(X509_STORE_CTX *ctx, int depth);
279
280#define X509_STORE_CTX_set_app_data(ctx,data) \
281 X509_STORE_CTX_set_ex_data(ctx,0,data)
282#define X509_STORE_CTX_get_app_data(ctx) \
283 X509_STORE_CTX_get_ex_data(ctx,0)
284
285#define X509_L_FILE_LOAD 1
286#define X509_L_ADD_DIR 2
287
288#define X509_LOOKUP_load_file(x,name,type) \
289 X509_LOOKUP_ctrl((x),X509_L_FILE_LOAD,(name),(long)(type),NULL)
290
291#define X509_LOOKUP_add_dir(x,name,type) \
292 X509_LOOKUP_ctrl((x),X509_L_ADD_DIR,(name),(long)(type),NULL)
293
294#define X509_V_OK 0
295/* illegal error (for uninitialized values, to avoid X509_V_OK): 1 */
296
297#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT 2
298#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_CRL 3
299#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECRYPT_CERT_SIGNATURE 4
300#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECRYPT_CRL_SIGNATURE 5
301#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECODE_ISSUER_PUBLIC_KEY 6
302#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_SIGNATURE_FAILURE 7
303#define X509_V_ERR_CRL_SIGNATURE_FAILURE 8
304#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_NOT_YET_VALID 9
305#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_HAS_EXPIRED 10
306#define X509_V_ERR_CRL_NOT_YET_VALID 11
307#define X509_V_ERR_CRL_HAS_EXPIRED 12
308#define X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CERT_NOT_BEFORE_FIELD 13
309#define X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CERT_NOT_AFTER_FIELD 14
310#define X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CRL_LAST_UPDATE_FIELD 15
311#define X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CRL_NEXT_UPDATE_FIELD 16
312#define X509_V_ERR_OUT_OF_MEM 17
313#define X509_V_ERR_DEPTH_ZERO_SELF_SIGNED_CERT 18
314#define X509_V_ERR_SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN 19
315#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT_LOCALLY 20
316#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_VERIFY_LEAF_SIGNATURE 21
317#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_CHAIN_TOO_LONG 22
318#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_REVOKED 23
319#define X509_V_ERR_INVALID_CA 24
320#define X509_V_ERR_PATH_LENGTH_EXCEEDED 25
321#define X509_V_ERR_INVALID_PURPOSE 26
322#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_UNTRUSTED 27
323#define X509_V_ERR_CERT_REJECTED 28
324/* These are 'informational' when looking for issuer cert */
325#define X509_V_ERR_SUBJECT_ISSUER_MISMATCH 29
326#define X509_V_ERR_AKID_SKID_MISMATCH 30
327#define X509_V_ERR_AKID_ISSUER_SERIAL_MISMATCH 31
328#define X509_V_ERR_KEYUSAGE_NO_CERTSIGN 32
329
330#define X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_CRL_ISSUER 33
331#define X509_V_ERR_UNHANDLED_CRITICAL_EXTENSION 34
332#define X509_V_ERR_KEYUSAGE_NO_CRL_SIGN 35
333#define X509_V_ERR_UNHANDLED_CRITICAL_CRL_EXTENSION 36
334#define X509_V_ERR_INVALID_NON_CA 37
335#define X509_V_ERR_PROXY_PATH_LENGTH_EXCEEDED 38
336#define X509_V_ERR_KEYUSAGE_NO_DIGITAL_SIGNATURE 39
337#define X509_V_ERR_PROXY_CERTIFICATES_NOT_ALLOWED 40
338
339#define X509_V_ERR_INVALID_EXTENSION 41
340#define X509_V_ERR_INVALID_POLICY_EXTENSION 42
341#define X509_V_ERR_NO_EXPLICIT_POLICY 43
342#define X509_V_ERR_DIFFERENT_CRL_SCOPE 44
343#define X509_V_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_EXTENSION_FEATURE 45
344
345#define X509_V_ERR_UNNESTED_RESOURCE 46
346
347#define X509_V_ERR_PERMITTED_VIOLATION 47
348#define X509_V_ERR_EXCLUDED_VIOLATION 48
349#define X509_V_ERR_SUBTREE_MINMAX 49
350#define X509_V_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_CONSTRAINT_TYPE 51
351#define X509_V_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_CONSTRAINT_SYNTAX 52
352#define X509_V_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_NAME_SYNTAX 53
353#define X509_V_ERR_CRL_PATH_VALIDATION_ERROR 54
354
355/* Suite B mode algorithm violation */
356#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_INVALID_VERSION 56
357#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_INVALID_ALGORITHM 57
358#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_INVALID_CURVE 58
359#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_INVALID_SIGNATURE_ALGORITHM 59
360#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_LOS_NOT_ALLOWED 60
361#define X509_V_ERR_SUITE_B_CANNOT_SIGN_P_384_WITH_P_256 61
362
363/* Host, email and IP check errors */
364#define X509_V_ERR_HOSTNAME_MISMATCH 62
365#define X509_V_ERR_EMAIL_MISMATCH 63
366#define X509_V_ERR_IP_ADDRESS_MISMATCH 64
367
368/* The application is not happy */
369#define X509_V_ERR_APPLICATION_VERIFICATION 50
370
371/* Certificate verify flags */
372
373/* Send issuer+subject checks to verify_cb */
374#define X509_V_FLAG_CB_ISSUER_CHECK 0x1
375/* Use check time instead of current time */
376#define X509_V_FLAG_USE_CHECK_TIME 0x2
377/* Lookup CRLs */
378#define X509_V_FLAG_CRL_CHECK 0x4
379/* Lookup CRLs for whole chain */
380#define X509_V_FLAG_CRL_CHECK_ALL 0x8
381/* Ignore unhandled critical extensions */
382#define X509_V_FLAG_IGNORE_CRITICAL 0x10
383/* Disable workarounds for broken certificates */
384#define X509_V_FLAG_X509_STRICT 0x20
385/* Enable proxy certificate validation */
386#define X509_V_FLAG_ALLOW_PROXY_CERTS 0x40
387/* Enable policy checking */
388#define X509_V_FLAG_POLICY_CHECK 0x80
389/* Policy variable require-explicit-policy */
390#define X509_V_FLAG_EXPLICIT_POLICY 0x100
391/* Policy variable inhibit-any-policy */
392#define X509_V_FLAG_INHIBIT_ANY 0x200
393/* Policy variable inhibit-policy-mapping */
394#define X509_V_FLAG_INHIBIT_MAP 0x400
395/* Notify callback that policy is OK */
396#define X509_V_FLAG_NOTIFY_POLICY 0x800
397/* Extended CRL features such as indirect CRLs, alternate CRL signing keys */
398#define X509_V_FLAG_EXTENDED_CRL_SUPPORT 0x1000
399/* Delta CRL support */
400#define X509_V_FLAG_USE_DELTAS 0x2000
401/* Check selfsigned CA signature */
402#define X509_V_FLAG_CHECK_SS_SIGNATURE 0x4000
403/* Use trusted store first */
404#define X509_V_FLAG_TRUSTED_FIRST 0x8000
405/* Suite B 128 bit only mode: not normally used */
406#define X509_V_FLAG_SUITEB_128_LOS_ONLY 0x10000
407/* Suite B 192 bit only mode */
408#define X509_V_FLAG_SUITEB_192_LOS 0x20000
409/* Suite B 128 bit mode allowing 192 bit algorithms */
410#define X509_V_FLAG_SUITEB_128_LOS 0x30000
411
412/* Allow partial chains if at least one certificate is in trusted store */
413#define X509_V_FLAG_PARTIAL_CHAIN 0x80000
414
415#define X509_VP_FLAG_DEFAULT 0x1
416#define X509_VP_FLAG_OVERWRITE 0x2
417#define X509_VP_FLAG_RESET_FLAGS 0x4
418#define X509_VP_FLAG_LOCKED 0x8
419#define X509_VP_FLAG_ONCE 0x10
420
421/* Internal use: mask of policy related options */
422#define X509_V_FLAG_POLICY_MASK (X509_V_FLAG_POLICY_CHECK \
423 | X509_V_FLAG_EXPLICIT_POLICY \
424 | X509_V_FLAG_INHIBIT_ANY \
425 | X509_V_FLAG_INHIBIT_MAP)
426
